subject: [Radiance-general] Re: Radiance in Debian
body:
Hi,

unfortunately the radiance package builds two programs in /usr/bin which
have a name clash with other packages:

- rcalc
- genbox

According to Debian's policy this is not allowed to have two programs
with the same name and different functionality in different packages. If
the package maintainer can't find a solution, the binaries of both
packages have to be renamed.

For rcalc the maintainer of the rcalc package agreed to rename the
binary to grcalc, so this doesn't mean any change for us.

After discussing the issue with the maintainers of the other package
which provides the genbox binary I have agreed to rename genbox in
Debian, as their package (gromacs, a molecular dynamics simulator) is in
Debian since a long time and their genbox is also used in a lot of
scripts which run it on large clusters. Imho agreeing here to rename
genbox is the only right way to go, although this is a bit annoying for
radiance users of course.

My suggestion would be to rename genbox to genrbox, but I'm open for any
other suggestion.
The rename will be documented in /usr/share/doc/{README,NEWS}.Debian and
of course nobody will be stopped to add a symlink on their system which
points form genbox to genrbox - but I can't ship this link with Debian.


Any suggestions and wishes are welcome.

Cheers,

Bernd
